subject: Re: Digest Number 739
msgSnippet: ... This is all definitely worth knowing, but my immediate guess is that the JUnitDoclet user is (re)generating far too many tests at once, irrespective of
messageBody:
> A generator could put fail(); in any empty tests very easy.
> But there is a major downside too, especially for regenerating
> tools loke JUnitDoclet. I don't want to copy/paste half
> a page to this email, please see:
> http://www.junitdoclet.org/faq.html#fail_not_default

This is all definitely worth knowing, but my immediate guess is that
the JUnitDoclet user is (re)generating far too many tests at once,
irrespective of whether those tests say fail() or not.

It is important for us to remember our TDD bias. :)

-- JBR.
